summary: porcine deltacoronavirus (PDCoV), also known as porcine coronavirus HKU15, was reported in china in 2012 and identified in the u.s. in early 2014. since then, PDCoV has been linked with clinical disease including acute diarrhea and vomiting in the absence of other identifiable pathogens. the fluorescent microsphere immunoassay (FMIA) showed a DSe of 95.8 % and DSp of 98.1 %. both ELISA and FMIA detected seroconversion of challenged pigs between 8–14 days post-infection.
